alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 05 at 3:11PM MST until March 05 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 6 PM MST TODAY FOR THE NORTHEAST AND EAST CENTRAL PLAINS, NORTHEAST AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM TO 6 PM MONDAY FOR THE CENTRAL HIGHLANDS, NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AND NORTHEAST PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES... .Southwest to west winds will remain strong through the evening with humidities less than 15 percent and above normal temperatures. Winds will not be quite as strong on Monday, but still sufficient for critical fire weather conditions across much of northeast New Mexico and the Central Highlands. Several hours of single digit humidity values and above average temperatures are also expected. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...East Central Plains (Zone 126) through this afternoon. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 25 to 35 mph with gusts to around 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from around 7 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
